​

The x axis ranges from 0 to 12 in increments of 1.

The y axis ranges from 1 to 1,000. 

The values 1, 10, 100, and 1,000 are shown equally spaced with 9 tick marks between each pair of successive values, getting closer and closer together moving up. 

All coordinates are approximate. 

The graph appears to be a line, beginning at (0 comma 2.3) and ending at (12 comma 130).

​The figure is the graph of the function <math alttext="f"><semantics><mi>f</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> given by <math alttext="f open parentheses x close parentheses equals 2.3 open parentheses 1.4 close parentheses to the power of x"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>2.3</mn><msup><mfenced><mn>1.4</mn></mfenced><mi>x</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>. Of the following, which is the best explanation as to why the graph appears linear?

choices.label: ​The horizontal axis has a logarithmic scale, and <math alttext="f open parentheses log subscript 10 x close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> can be written as a linear expression of <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> with a constant rate of change of <math alttext="log subscript 10 open parentheses 1.4 close parentheses"><semantics><mrow><msub><mi>log</mi><mn>10</mn></msub><mfenced><mn>1.4</mn></mfenced></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>.
